Package scheduleApp.Controllers

Class AppointmentsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduleApp.Controllers.AppointmentsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AppointmentsController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The AppointmentsController class is the Controller class used to handle the program logic while the user is viewing the Appointments Form. It interfaces heavily with the AppointmentsDAO class to pull data from the Model classes in the database.
    Author:
    Jason Jackson

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addButtonClicked()
      This method is called when the user has filled out the form manually, does not have an appointment selected, and clicks the add button.
      void addOrModifyClicked()
      This method checks whether the addModify button is currently showing add or if it shows modify, then routes the program to the appropriate functionality.
      void clearButtonClicked()
      This method is called when the clear selection button is clicked.
      void deleteButtonClicked()
      This method is called when the user selects an appointment and then clicks the delete button.
      void exitButtonClicked​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when the exit button is clicked by the user.
      void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes all of the form fields, sets up the proper tableView column factories, and creates a listener for the Appointments TableView using a lambda expression.
      private boolean isSchedulingConflict​(Appointment newAppointment)
      This method checks whether a new appointment will conflict schedules with any existing appointments.
      void modifyButtonClicked()
      This method is called when the user has selected an appointment, had the form fill out automatically, and clicks the modify button.
      void populateTableView()
      This method will populate the Appointments TableView corresponding with whether the weekly, monthly, or all view radio button is selected.
      private void populateTimeComboBoxes()
      This method is called to populate the Start Time and End Time combo boxes with times starting at 00:00 to 23:45 in 15 minute intervals.
      private Appointment validAppointment()
      This method will check that all the form fields are valid, ensure that the appointment falls within business hours and does not conflict with other appointments.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        This method initializes all of the form fields, sets up the proper tableView column factories, and creates a listener for the Appointments TableView using a lambda expression. LAMBDA JUSTIFICATION: The lambda is very helpful in this method because it quickly and cleanly sets up the listener for the TableView to update the form fields and change the addModify button to the modify state. If not for using this lambda, I would have had to pass multiple values to one or more methods.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - the url
        resourceBundle - the resourceBundle

      • populateTimeComboBoxes

        private void populateTimeComboBoxes()
        This method is called to populate the Start Time and End Time combo boxes with times starting at 00:00 to 23:45 in 15 minute intervals.

      • addOrModifyClicked

        public void addOrModifyClicked()
        This method checks whether the addModify button is currently showing add or if it shows modify, then routes the program to the appropriate functionality.

      • addButtonClicked

        public void addButtonClicked()
        This method is called when the user has filled out the form manually, does not have an appointment selected, and clicks the add button. It will add a new appointment to the database if the form fields are valid.

      • modifyButtonClicked

        public void modifyButtonClicked()
        This method is called when the user has selected an appointment, had the form fill out automatically, and clicks the modify button. It will update the selected appointment in the database if the form fields are valid.

      • deleteButtonClicked

        public void deleteButtonClicked()
        This method is called when the user selects an appointment and then clicks the delete button. It will delete the selected appointment from the database after a confirmation window is confirmed.

      • clearButtonClicked

        public void clearButtonClicked()
        This method is called when the clear selection button is clicked. It will deselect an appointment from the tableView and then reset all the form fields to their default value.

      • validAppointment

        private Appointment validAppointment()
        This method will check that all the form fields are valid, ensure that the appointment falls within business hours and does not conflict with other appointments. If so, it will return the valid appointment. If not, it will return null.
        Returns:
        the valid appointment if the form is valid, otherwise null

      • isSchedulingConflict

        private boolean isSchedulingConflict​(Appointment newAppointment)
        This method checks whether a new appointment will conflict schedules with any existing appointments.
        Parameters:
        newAppointment - the appointment to test against other scheduling conflicts.
        Returns:
        a boolean whether the schedule is in conflict or not.

      • exitButtonClicked

        public void exitButtonClicked​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called when the exit button is clicked by the user. It will return the user to the Main Form.
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent from the click.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • populateTableView

        public void populateTableView()
        This method will populate the Appointments TableView corresponding with whether the weekly, monthly, or all view radio button is selected.
